Description: Anchor links should scroll smoothly to target section
Do: Use scroll-behavior: smooth on html element

Description: Fixed nav should not obscure content
Do: Add padding-top to body equal to nav height
Don't: Let nav overlap first section content

Description: Current page/section should be visually indicated
Do: Highlight active nav item with color/underline
Don't: No visual feedback on current location

Description: Users expect back to work predictably
URLs should reflect current state for sharing
Show user location in site hierarchy
Do: Use for sites with 3+ levels of depth

Description: Too many animations cause distraction and motion sickness
Do: Animate 1-2 key elements per view maximum

Description: Animations should feel responsive not sluggish
Don't: Use animations longer than 500ms for UI

Description: Respect user's motion preferences
Show feedback during async operations
Don't: Leave UI frozen with no feedback

Description: Hover effects don't work on touch devices
Don't: Rely only on hover for important actions

Description: Infinite animations are distracting
Some CSS properties trigger expensive repaints
Do: Use transform and opacity for animations

Description: Linear motion feels robotic
Do: Use ease-out for entering ease-in for exiting

Description: Stacking context conflicts cause hidden elements
Hidden overflow can clip important content
Do: Test all content fits within containers

Description: Fixed elements can overlap or be inaccessible
Do: Account for safe areas and other fixed elements
Code Example Good: Fixed nav + fixed bottom with gap

Description: New stacking contexts reset z-index
Do: Understand what creates new stacking context
Don't: Expect z-index to work across contexts

Description: Layout shift when content loads is jarring
100vh can be problematic on mobile browsers
Do: Use dvh or account for mobile browser chrome

Description: Content too wide is hard to read
Don't: Let text span full viewport width

Description: Small buttons are hard to tap accurately
Adjacent touch targets need adequate spacing
Custom gestures can conflict with system
Do: Avoid horizontal swipe on main content

Description: 300ms tap delay feels laggy
Accidental refresh is frustrating
Tactile feedback improves interaction feel
Do: Use for confirmations and important actions

Description: Keyboard users need visible focus indicators
Do: Use visible focus rings on interactive elements

Description: Visual feedback on interactive elements
Do: Change cursor and add subtle visual change
Don't: No hover feedback on clickable elements

Description: Show immediate feedback on press/click
Clearly indicate non-interactive elements
Prevent double submission during async actions
Do: Disable button and show loading state

Description: Users need to know when something fails
Do: Show clear error messages near problem

Description: Confirm successful actions to users
Do: Show success message or visual change

Description: Prevent accidental destructive actions
Text must be readable against background
Don't convey information by color alone
Do: Use icons/text in addition to color

Description: Images need text alternatives
Do: Descriptive alt text for meaningful images

Description: Screen readers use headings for navigation
Don't: Skip heading levels or misuse for styling

Description: Interactive elements need accessible names
All functionality accessible via keyboard
Don't: Keyboard traps or illogical tab order

Description: Content should make sense when read aloud
Do: Use semantic HTML and ARIA properly

Description: Inputs must have associated labels
Do: Use label with for attribute or wrap input

Description: Error messages must be announced
Do: Use aria-live or role=alert for errors

Description: Allow keyboard users to skip navigation
Do: Provide skip to main content link
Don't: No skip link on nav-heavy pages

Description: Large images slow page load
Load content as needed
Do: Lazy load below-fold images and content

Description: Large bundles slow initial load
Repeat visits should be fast
Web fonts can block rendering
External scripts can block rendering
Large JavaScript slows interaction
CSS/JS can block first paint
Every input needs a visible label
Do: Always show label above or beside input

Description: Errors should appear near the problem
Don't: Single error message at top of form

Description: Validate as user types or on blur
Do: Validate on blur for most fields

Description: Use appropriate input types
Do: Use email tel number url etc

Description: Help browsers autofill correctly
Mark required fields clearly
Let users see password while typing
Confirm form submission status
Inputs should look interactive
Don't: Inputs that look like plain text

Description: Show appropriate keyboard for input type
Design for mobile then enhance for larger
Do: Start with mobile styles then add breakpoints

Description: Test at all common screen sizes
Mobile layouts need touch-sized targets
Text must be readable on all devices
Set viewport for mobile devices
Avoid horizontal scrolling
Images should scale with container
Tables can overflow on mobile
Do: Use horizontal scroll or card layout

Description: Adequate line height improves readability
Long lines are hard to read
Consistent type hierarchy aids scanning
Fonts should load without layout shift
Body text needs good contrast
Do: Use darker text on light backgrounds

Description: Headings should stand out from body
Show system status during waits
Guide users when no content exists
Help users recover from errors
Show progress for multi-step processes
Transient messages for non-critical info
Confirm successful actions
Handle long content gracefully
Do: Truncate with ellipsis and expand option

Description: Use locale-appropriate date formats
Format large numbers for readability
Show realistic placeholders during dev
Users should be able to skip tutorials
Help users find results faster
Dead ends frustrate users
Editing one by one is tedious
Users need to know they talk to AI
Waiting for full text is slow
Do: Stream text response token by token

Description: Elements should respond to eye tracking before pinch
UI needs Z-depth to separate content from environment
Video consumes massive data and energy
Heavy 3D/Image assets increase carbon footprint
AI needs user feedback to improve
Parallax/Scroll-jacking causes nausea
Users need clear visual feedback on their progress through multi-step processes to reduce anxiety and improve completion rates.
Do: Display a progress bar or step indicator showing current step and total steps with completion percentage.
Don't:
Hide progress or use vague indicators like "Step 3 of many".
  1. Step 1
  2. Step 2
  3. Step 3

Description: Validate form fields on each step before allowing progression to prevent data loss and ensure data quality.
Do: Implement client-side validation with inline error messages and server-side validation as backup.
Don't: Allow progression with invalid data or validate only at final submission.<input required pattern="[A-Za-z]{3

Description: Automatically save user progress to allow resuming interrupted flows and reduce abandonment.
Do: Use localStorage or sessionStorage to persist form data across sessions and browsers.
Don't: Require users to start over if they leave and return.<script>localStorage.setItem('wizardData'

Description: Allow free navigation between steps (forward/back) while preserving data to support iterative refinement.
Do: Enable back/forward buttons that maintain data state without reset.
Don't: Disable back navigation or reset data when going back.<button onclick="wizard.prevStep()">← Back</button> <button onclick="wizard.nextStep()">Next →</button>

Description: Clearly indicate task completion with success states
Don't: and next steps to provide closure.

Abruptly redirect or show blank success page.

View Dashboard

Description: Reveal information and features gradually to avoid overwhelming new users.
Don't: unlock advanced options after basic setup.
Code Example Good:
Display all features/options immediately on first visit.
Basic setup
Pro features

Description: Guide users through key features with non-intrusive tooltips or spotlight tours.
Code Example Good:
Force mandatory tours that block usage until completion.
Welcome! This is your dashboard

Description: Provide helpful guidance in empty states to encourage first actions.
Code Example Good: and value propositions in empty states.
Code Example Bad:
Show blank pages or generic "No data" messages.

Get started

Upload your first file

Description: Highlight key features contextually when users are likely to need them.
Do: Use micro-animations or badges on first use of features.
Don't: Hide features completely or use complex menus.New!

Description: Explain clearly why permissions are needed and allow granular control.
Do: Use just-in-time permission requests with benefit statements.
Don't:
Request all permissions upfront or use vague explanations.
Allow camera access to scan documents?

Faster onboarding

Description: Provide inline
Do: specific error messages immediately upon invalid input.
Don't: Show field-specific errors with examples of correct format.
Code Example Good: Use generic error messages at form top only.Email must be valid (e.g. user@example.com)

Description: Handle API failures gracefully with user-friendly messages and recovery options.
Do: Display human-readable error messages from API status codes.
Don't:
Show raw error codes or technical details.
Server busy. Contact support

Description: Enable core functionality when offline and sync when reconnected.
Do: Cache recent actions and show offline status indicator.
Don't:
Disable app completely when offline.
Offline - changes will sync later

Description: Warn users before session timeout and allow extension.
Do: Show countdown timer and "Stay logged in" option.
Don't:
Silently log out after timeout.
5 min until logout

Description: Provide easy retry options for failed operations with exponential backoff.
Do: Show "Retry" buttons and optimistic updates where possible.<button onclick="retryUpload()" class="retry-btn">Retry upload (2/3)</button>

Description: Support right-to-left languages with proper text direction and layout flipping.
Do: Use dir="rtl" attribute and mirror layouts for RTL languages.
Don't:
Hardcode left-to-right layouts for all languages.
محتوى RTL

Description: Display dates/times in user's locale format automatically.
Do: Use Intl.DateTimeFormat API for locale-aware formatting.
Don't: Hardcode MM/DD/YYYY format globally.<script>new Intl.DateTimeFormat('ar-SA').format(new Date())</script>

Description: Design layouts to accommodate text expansion in different languages (up to 30-50% longer).
Do: Use flexible layouts with min-width constraints.
Don't:
Fixed-width containers that overflow in expanded languages.
Translated text

Description: Show locale-appropriate currency symbols and formatting.
Adapt layouts for reading direction
Code Example Good: Detect locale and apply appropriate layout variants.
Code Example Bad:
Single rigid layout for all locales.
Left-aligned
Right-aligned

Description: Enable intuitive column sorting with clear visual indicators.
Do: Use clickable headers with sort direction arrows.
Don't: Make sorting undiscoverable or inconsistent.<th onclick="sort('name')" aria-sort="ascending">Name ↑</th>

Description: Show filter status
Code Example Good: Persist filter state and show "X of Y results".
Code Example Bad:
Hide filter criteria or reset filters unexpectedly.
Status: Active (23 of 150)

Description: Support bulk selection with select-all and action confirmations.
Do: Limit bulk actions to reasonable batch sizes with progress.
Don't:
Allow unlimited bulk actions without confirmation.
Confirm delete 47 items?

Description: Choose pagination for precision tasks
Don't: Use pagination for data tables with export/search.
Code Example Good:
Infinite scroll for tables requiring exact counts/navigation.
Page 3 of 15 ...

Description: Provide multiple export formats with clear data previews.
Code Example Bad: Export all data without preview or format choice.<button onclick="exportCSV(selectedColumns)">Export CSV (50 rows

Description: Provide real-time search suggestions as users type.
Don't: No suggestions or slow/non-debounced search.<input oninput="debouncedSearch(this.value)"><datalist id="suggestions"><option>Recent search</option></datalist>

Description: Show personalized recent searches to speed up repeat queries.
Code Example Bad:
No history or show irrelevant popular searches.

Code Example Good:
related searches.

Description: Allow multi-select filters that update results count instantly.
Do: Persist filter combinations and show applied filters.
Don't: Single-select only or slow filter updates.

Description: Users perceive latency as poor quality
New users drop off if dashboard is blank
Do: Show "Create New" CTA and educational illustration

Description: Delightful details increase engagement
Do: Use subtle "pop" or "twinkle" on success states

Description: Long lists overwhelm users
Do: Group related links under collapsible headers

Description: Verbose labels increase cognitive load
Do: Use single words (Voting) vs Sentences (Last 10 Votes)

Description: Inconsistent spacing looks unprofessional
Forms need immediate context not just labels
Lists are bad for "part-to-whole" comparisons
Do: Use Pie/Donut for Credit Limit vs Used

Description: Text-only dropdowns are hard to scan
Do: Add icons or thumbnails to descriptive menu items

Description: Long scroll pages lose context
Lack of response feels broken
Do: Gray out button + Loading spinner on click

Description: Mismatched icons look amateur
Garish gradients look cheap
Do: Use variations of same hue (Green-400 to Green-600)
